smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams were found. All pages contain model elements.

All use cases are associated with actors either directly (e.g., 'Registreeri auto' to 'Autode haldur') or indirectly through <include> relationships (e.g., 'Vaata kõiki ootel...' is included by 'Aktiveeri auto', which is connected to an actor).
No synonym use cases associated with the same actor were found. Use cases like 'Muuda autot' and 'Registreeri auto' represent distinct activities.
No duplicate model elements were found within the same package. Elements with the same name across diagrams (e.g., 'Auto') refer to the same element in different views.
No obvious redundancy or denormalization was detected. Tables use foreign keys (e.g., 'riik_kood') rather than duplicating data strings.
Use case naming is consistent. All use cases begin with a verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Registreeri', 'Muuda').
In the state diagram (Auto seisundidiagramm), all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, etc.) are reachable from the start state through valid transitions.
In the activity diagram (Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm), all actions are reachable via the decision branches.
Multiplicity indicators (e.g., 1, 0..*) are present on relationships in class and database diagrams (e.g., 'Isik' to 'Kasutajakonto').
No diagram contains 10 or more central elements. The most populated diagram (Page 15) contains 9 tables.
No class or table displays 6 or more visual connection lines on a single diagram page. The maximum observed was 4 visual connections on Page 17 for the 'Auto' table.
Diagram layouts are balanced, and the distance between related elements is generally uniform.
Use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali').
All classes, tables, and use cases have names longer than 3 characters (e.g., 'Isik', 'Riik').
Class names start with uppercase letters and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Töötaja').
Attribute names start with lowercase letters (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'mudel').

The 'Klassifikaator' class (found on Page 7 and Page 8) contains attributes with type prefixes: 'bool_on_aktiivne', 'chr_nimetus', and 'chr_kood'. This uses Hungarian notation/type prefixing which violates the rule.
